ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course teaches Polish at an intermediate level
different words phrases and tricks to speak polish
This course taught me the basics of Polish in an intimate and supportive setting.
I gained a great understanding of the Polish language and Polish culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Prof Illakowicz is one of the kindest and most intelligent professors I have ever encountered. She is the strength of the course!
A strength of this course is that it caters to each student very effectively, so its easy to staty up to date and not fall behind on work.

The strengths are Professor Illakowiczs. She is incredibly dedicated to the class and makes a very honest effort to ensure that everyone is learning and on the same page. The weaknesses are the organization of the class; it would be nice to know the dates of tests and assignments farther in advance to help plan.
In class discussion was great in helping us understand the language.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend Polish for the chance to take a class from Prof Illakowicz
This is a great course if you'd like a fun language or are interested in slavic languages.
yes its a very interesting course with a great teacher
Yes, if you are looking for a fun and relatively low workload language requirement.
Yes, it's a great class to take if you have any interest in Poland and their language and practices.
I would recommend taking Polish to another student.
